instincts.title: Verify code exists before closing completed tickets
instincts.trigger: Ticket marked 'ready to merge' or 'implementation complete'
instincts.action: Use glob/read to verify actual code files exist in codebase before closing the ticket. Look for expected file paths (e.g., src/vibe_piper/connectors/*.py for database connector tickets)

instincts.title: Check Loom command permissions before acting as Team Manager
instincts.trigger: Acting as Team Manager for Loom team
instincts.action: Verify permission rules allow `loom team *` commands early. If only `loom ticket *` is allowed, document blocker immediately and proceed with ticket-only workflow.

instincts.title: Sync ticket updates after modifications
instincts.trigger: After any `loom ticket` command that changes state (close, add-note, update)
instincts.action: Run `loom ticket sync` to commit ticket changes to repository

instincts.title: Add detailed notes when creating tickets
instincts.trigger: Created new ticket via loom ticket create
instincts.action: Immediately add a note to the ticket with: 1) Tasks numbered list, 2) Dependencies (if any), 3) Acceptance criteria, 4) Technical notes, 5) Example usage (if feature)

instincts.title: Check for complete-but-unmerged tickets
instincts.trigger: Listing tickets shows in_progress status but implementation is complete
instincts.action: For each in_progress ticket: check if implementation is done (git log shows recent feature commits, ticket notes say 'implementation complete'), if yes but not merged: add URGENT note with commit hash and branch name, request merge to merge-queue

instincts.title: Document ticket dependencies in notes
instincts.trigger: Starting work on a ticket that depends on others or creating a ticket that other tickets will depend on
instincts.action: Add a note starting with 'DEPENDENCIES:' listing all ticket IDs this ticket depends on, with brief explanation of relationship and priority guidance (when to work on this)

instincts.title: Inspect git state before ticket actions
instincts.trigger: About to merge a ticket branch or assess completion status
instincts.action: Run git log <branch> --oneline -5 to see recent commits, git diff main <branch> --stat to see change scope, check if commits look like implementation vs cleanup, verify branch exists and is ahead of main

instincts.title: Organize tickets by phase in tags
instincts.trigger: Creating tickets for sequential project phases
instincts.action: Add phase tags (phase1, phase2, phase3) to tickets and ensure lower-priority tickets have dependency notes referencing higher-priority phase tickets that must complete first

instincts.title: Verify code exists before closing tickets
instincts.trigger: Worker marks ticket ready for review/merge
instincts.action: Before closing ticket, use glob to verify expected code files exist in codebase (e.g., src/vibe_piper/connectors/*.py for database connector tickets). This prevents closing tickets where implementation notes exist but no actual code was committed.

instincts.title: Handle git workspace cleanup failures
instincts.trigger: Attempting to retire worker after merge
instincts.action: When 'loom team retire <worker>' fails with 'modified or untracked files' error, check worktree status with git status and either: 1) Stash uncommitted changes, 2) Use --force flag if safe to delete, or 3) Manually clean up files before retrying retirement.

instincts.title: Phase 3 P1 tickets depend on orchestration engine
instincts.trigger: Starting Phase 3 ticket implementation
instincts.action: Orchestration Engine (vp-cf95) must complete before CLI (vp-6cf1), Scheduling (vp-7d49), and Monitoring (vp-f17e) can fully integrate. Verify orchestration engine is in codebase before spawning workers for dependent tickets.

instincts.title: Import optional dependencies with try/except and type ignore
instincts.trigger: Need to use external library that may not be installed
instincts.action:
1. Wrap import in try/except block
2. Add type: ignore[import-untyped] comment for mypy
3. Set flag variable to track availability
4. Provide fallback behavior when unavailable
5. Document degradation in docstring

instincts.title: Coalesce None datetime values before arithmetic
instincts.trigger: Performing datetime arithmetic with potentially None fields
instincts.action: Always use: (field or datetime.utcnow()) to ensure arithmetic operations have datetime, not Optional[datetime]

instincts.title: Use separate variables for different formatter types
instincts.trigger: MyPy complains about incompatible formatter assignments
instincts.action: Create distinct variables (json_formatter, colored_formatter, simple_formatter) instead of reusing single 'formatter' variable to avoid type checker confusion

instincts.title: Use Series.str accessor for text operations on DataFrames
instincts.trigger: Applying string methods (trim, upper, lower, title) to pandas DataFrame columns
instincts.action: Always use df[col].str.method() for column operations, never operate on individual strings. The Series.str accessor returns a StringMethods object that operates on the entire series efficiently.

instincts.title: Mark schema fields nullable when test data contains None values
instincts.trigger: Creating test fixtures with DataRecord objects that have null values in specific fields
instincts.action: Set nullable=True on SchemaField definitions for any field that may contain None in test data. DataRecord.__post_init__ raises ValueError if a non-nullable field contains None.

instincts.title: Handle float-to-int type conversion when replacing outliers
instincts.trigger: Replacing outliers with mean/median (always float) into integer columns
instincts.action: Either use .astype(float) on the column before replacement to allow float values, or cast mean_val to int explicitly using int(mean_val) when the target column is integer type.

instincts.title: Update transformations/__init__.py exports for new transformation modules
instincts.trigger: Creating new transformation modules (aggregations, cleaning, windows, etc.)
instincts.action: Immediately update src/vibe_piper/transformations/__init__.py to include __all__ exports from the new module with descriptive docstring categories (e.g., # Cleaning, # Aggregations).

instincts.title: Use 'auto' for Isolation Forest max_samples
instincts.trigger: Using sklearn.ensemble.IsolationForest
instincts.action: Set max_samples='auto' instead of None (scikit-learn v1.5+ requires explicit value)

instincts.title: Create nullable schemas for null testing
instincts.trigger: Testing null handling in DataRecords
instincts.action: Define SchemaField with nullable=True when fixture may contain None values to avoid DataRecord validation errors

instincts.title: Add type: ignore[import-untyped] for optional sklearn/numpy
instincts.trigger: Importing sklearn or numpy with try/except for optional dependency
instincts.action: Include '# type: ignore[import-untyped]' on import statement to satisfy mypy strict mode while allowing graceful degradation

instincts.title: Expectation functions return ValidationResult
instincts.trigger: Creating validation expectation for @validate decorator
instincts.action: Ensure custom validation functions return ValidationResult(is_valid=..., errors=(...)) for compatibility with ValidationConfig.checks

instincts.title: Store drift baselines as JSON with metadata
instincts.trigger: implementing drift detection with historical comparison
instincts.action: save baseline data to JSON file with metadata (timestamp, sample_size, columns, schema_name) for efficient retrieval

instincts.title: Validate drift thresholds on configuration
instincts.trigger: creating DriftThresholds configuration class
instincts.action: validate that warning < critical, all thresholds in [0,1] range, and warning < psi_critical, with clear error messages

instincts.title: Track drift results with timestamps for trend analysis
instincts.trigger: implementing DriftHistory class for drift monitoring
instincts.action: store each drift check with timestamp, baseline_id, method, drift_score, and alert_level to enable temporal trend analysis

instincts.title: Wrap drift functions to return ValidationResult for @validate
instincts.trigger: creating check_drift_ks and check_drift_psi functions
instincts.action: map drift detection results to ValidationResult: is_valid=(alert_level != 'critical'), errors=list for critical, warnings=list for recommendations and drifted columns

instincts.title: Use TYPE_CHECKING for optional scipy.stats import
instincts.trigger: importing scipy.stats for KS/PSI/chi-square tests
instincts.action: import scipy inside function body with TYPE_CHECKING guard to prevent ImportError when scipy is not installed, keep import localized

instincts.title: Validate minimum sample size before running statistical drift tests
instincts.trigger: calling detect_drift_ks, detect_drift_psi, or detect_drift_chi_square
instincts.action: check that both baseline and new data have at least min_samples (default 50) before running test, return DriftResult with error message if insufficient

instincts.title: Create DataRecord fixtures with proper schema
instincts.trigger: writing pytest fixtures for drift detection tests
instincts.action: define schema fixtures with proper SchemaFields and DataType enums, use schema parameter when creating DataRecord instances

instincts.title: Resolve AI-managed file conflicts
instincts.trigger: Merge conflicts in AI-managed files (AGENTS.md, LOOM_ROADMAP.md, LOOM_PROJECT.md, CHANGELOG.md) when syncing merge-queue with origin/main
instincts.action: Accept incoming version with --theirs since AI-managed blocks are auto-generated by other agents. Use: git checkout --theirs AGENTS.md LOOM_ROADMAP.md

instincts.title: Check worktree before syncing
instincts.trigger: Attempting to merge origin/main into merge-queue branch
instincts.action: Run git status first. If modified files exist, commit or stash them before attempting the sync. This prevents ff-only failures and merge conflicts.

instincts.title: Search config files by format preference order
instincts.trigger: Implementing multi-format configuration support
instincts.action: When supporting multiple config formats (TOML/YAML/JSON), search for files in preference order rather than requiring explicit format parameter

instincts.title: Use two-pass parsing for config inheritance
instincts.trigger: Implementing environment inheritance
instincts.action: Parse all environments first, then merge in second pass to handle forward references (child inherits from parent)

instincts.title: Create dedicated apply_overrides() method for CLI overrides
instincts.trigger: Implementing runtime configuration overrides
instincts.action: Instead of modifying config in place, create a method that returns a new merged config with CLI overrides applied

instincts.title: Add both PyYAML and types-PyYAML for strict MyPy
instincts.trigger: Adding YAML format support in strict MyPy project
instincts.action: Install pyyaml runtime dependency and types-pyamal as dev dependency to satisfy strict type checking

instincts.title: Catch as general Exception then check isinstance
instincts.trigger: Catching multiple parser exception types with MyPy strict mode
instincts.action: Catch as Exception, then use isinstance() to distinguish specific parser errors vs generic IO errors

instincts.title: Validate cloud IO managers require bucket parameter
instincts.trigger: Validating environment configuration
instincts.action: When environment uses cloud IO manager (s3/gcs/azure), enforce that bucket parameter is provided

instincts.title: Document supported formats and patterns in module docstring
instincts.trigger: Implementing configuration module
instincts.action: Include examples of all supported formats, inheritance patterns, and runtime override usage in module-level docstring

instincts.title: Merge CLI overrides with environment-specific configs
instincts.trigger: Applying runtime configuration overrides
instincts.action: When applying CLI overrides, merge them with environment configs while preserving environment-specific values that aren't being overridden

instincts.title: Auto-store validation results in history
instincts.trigger: validation_completed
instincts.action: store_validation_result

instincts.title: Use FULL jitter by default to prevent thundering herd
instincts.trigger: Implemented jitter strategies (NONE, FULL, EQUAL, DECORRELATED) in retry system. Observed that FULL jitter (random 0 to delay) provides best protection against thundering herd when multiple clients retry simultaneously.
instincts.action: Set jitter_strategy=JitterStrategy.FULL as default in RetryConfig to prevent coordinated retry storms.

instincts.title: RetryMetrics should be mutable to track attempts
instincts.trigger: During retry decorator implementation, encountered mypy error when trying to update RetryMetrics fields. RetryMetrics was frozen=True which prevented field mutations during retry loop.
instincts.action: Change RetryMetrics from @dataclass(frozen=True) to @dataclass to allow mutable updates during retry attempts. Fields like total_attempts, dlq_sent, and circuit_breaker_opened need to be updated.

instincts.title: Circuit breaker benefits from configurable thresholds
instincts.trigger: Implemented circuit breaker with configurable failure_threshold, success_threshold, timeout_seconds, and exception_types. This allows fine-tuning for different service characteristics and failure patterns.
instincts.action: Use CircuitBreakerConfig with sensible defaults (failure_threshold=5, success_threshold=2, timeout_seconds=60.0) to provide automatic protection while allowing customization for specific use cases.

instincts.title: Use JWT with access+refresh tokens in FastAPI
instincts.trigger: Implementing FastAPI authentication
instincts.action: Use python-jose for JWT tokens (access expires 30min, refresh 7 days), passlib[bcrypt] for password hashing, OAuth2PasswordBearer for token scheme, store refresh tokens for rotation, return structured error responses

instincts.title: Include standard middleware in FastAPI apps
instincts.trigger: Creating new FastAPI application
instincts.action: Add CORS middleware (allow_origins=['http://localhost:5173', 'http://localhost:3000']), GZipMiddleware(minimum_size=1000), RequestIDMiddleware (X-Request-ID header), RateLimitMiddleware (token bucket: 60/min, 1000/hr) in that order

instincts.title: Create type-safe API service for React
instincts.trigger: Building React app that talks to API
instincts.action: Create src/services/api.ts with fetch wrapper, API_BASE_URL from env, headers with Authorization: Bearer token from localStorage, ApiError class with error/message/status fields, typed endpoints returning Promise<T>

instincts.title: Configure Tailwind CSS with Vite correctly
instincts.trigger: Setting up new React + Vite + Tailwind project
instincts.action: Install @tailwindcss/postcss, configure postcss.config.js with '@tailwindcss/postcss' plugin, add @tailwind directives to src/index.css, configure tsconfig.json path aliases (@/* -> ./src/*), add path resolver to vite.config.ts

instincts.title: Use React Context for authentication state
instincts.trigger: Implementing auth in React app
instincts.action: Create AuthProvider with useState for user/loading, checkAuth on mount, login/logout methods that call API, useAuth hook that exposes user/loading/login/logout/refreshUser, wrap App in AuthProvider
